chapter.title: Using the audiostore
chapter.para: Before you can start using the audiostore, the audiostore server must be running. [ Installation should be covered somewhere. Still undefined how the server integrates the audiostore with other parts of Remus. Likely, starting the server is the same regardless what components are installed. ]

Assuming the audiostore has been populated with some audio files, here's what it could look like using Nautilus:
Browsing the audiostore
As you can see, the top of the audiostore tree contains genre directories. Under each genre, you'll find artist directories, which contain album directories.

What differs the audiostore from a conventional file system, is it has alternative directory roots. One example is typing in http://url-base/music/artist which will list all artists regardless of genre.
Browsing the audiostore artists

Similarily it is possible to list all albums in the audiostore through the URL http://url-base/music/album:
Browsing the audiostore albums
